name: Toast
description: A toast component for displaying non-disruptive messages to the user

props.name: visible
props.description: Whether to show or hide the toast

props.name: position
props.description: The position of the toast. 'top' or 'bottom'.

props.name: centerMessage
props.description: Should message be centered in the toast

props.name: action
props.description: A single action for the user (showLoader will override this)

props.name: swipeable
props.description: Whether to support dismissing the toast with a swipe gesture. Requires to pass onDismiss method to control visibility

props.name: autoDismiss
props.description: Time of milliseconds to automatically invoke the onDismiss callback

props.name: onAnimationEnd
props.description: Callback for end of toast animation

props.name: renderAttachment
props.description: Render a custom view that will appear permanently above or below a Toast, depends on the Toast's position and animate with it when the Toast is made visible or dismissed

props.name: enableHapticFeedback
props.description: Whether to trigger an haptic feedback once the toast is shown (requires react-native-haptic-feedback dependency)

props.name: icon
props.description: A custom icon to render on the left side of the toast

hero.title: Toast
hero.description: Toasts give quick feedback or updates without interrupting the user. They’re used for non-critical messages, like success notifications, and disappear on their own. Toasts can include one action, but it shouldn’t be “Dismiss” or “Close.”

props.message: Mika Or was saved to contacts.

sections.title: Timing
sections.description:
markdown:
Toast disappears automatically after 5-10 seconds. The **default** duration depends on text length: [word count / 2] = X secs to disappear  
Examples: 
[15 words / 2] = 7.5 secs
[2 words / 2] = 1, but 5 secs is minimum >> 5 secs  
When using Toasts in your product, keep in mind that the default display time is preset but can be adjusted for messages that need more attention or reading time. However, the duration should never be less than 5 seconds.

sections.title: Spec
sections.description:
markdown:
**Positioning**
The Toast appears at the bottom of the screen, while keeping a spacing of S4 from the bottom of the screen, or from the bottom bar.  
The Toast can be placed above CTA’s in order to keep the CTA available for the user.  
Toast can be dismissed manually by swiping it down.

sections.title: Tablet Spec
sections.description:
markdown:
When displaying a Toast on a Tablet, the width of the component adjusts to the content.  
- Min-width: 200px  
- Max-width: 524px

sections.title: Do’s & Don’ts
sections.description:
markdown:
**Message Length**
Do not display long messages in a Toast, keep the Toast message short and focused, yet informative.  
Further information regarding the phrasing of toast messages can be found in UX Writers - Toast Guidelines.
